episodeTitle: The Great Swordsman Mihawk! Luffy Comes Under the Attack of the Black Sword!
description: Luffy encounters Mihawk while racing toward Ace. Using Gear 2, he attempts to evade, but Mihawk's vision allows him to attack from a distance. Jinbe intervenes briefly before Luffy employs Buggy as an improvised shield. Vista blocks Mihawk, allowing Luffy's advance. Meanwhile, Sengoku announces the Marines' impending victory as Sentomaru arrives commanding seven Pacifistas to assault Whitebeard's fleet, and Ace's execution time is moved up.

events.title: Luffy Encounters Mihawk on the Battlefield
events.description: While rushing toward the execution platform to save Ace, Luffy suddenly finds himself face-to-face with Dracule Mihawk, the world's greatest swordsman. Recognizing him as the man who defeated Zoro at the Baratie, Luffy realizes he doesn't have time to fight someone of Mihawk's caliber and must find a way around him.
events.significance: Establishes one of the major obstacles Luffy must overcome to reach Ace. This encounter demonstrates the overwhelming power of the world's greatest swordsman and forces Luffy to rely on evasion rather than confrontation.

events.title: Luffy Activates Gear 2 to Evade Mihawk
events.description: Deciding he cannot afford to waste time fighting Mihawk, Luffy activates Gear 2 to boost his speed and attempts to run past the swordsman using an alternative path. His body steams as he accelerates, trying to use his enhanced mobility to avoid direct confrontation.
events.significance: Shows Luffy's strategic thinking in choosing evasion over combat when the stakes are high. However, it also sets up the demonstration of Mihawk's exceptional abilities when even Gear 2 speed isn't enough to escape his perception.

events.title: Mihawk's Long-Range Slash Attacks Luffy
events.description: Despite Luffy's incredible speed in Gear 2, Mihawk's exceptional vision allows him to track Luffy's movements perfectly. With his black sword Yoru, Mihawk unleashes a powerful long-range slash that cuts through the battlefield, targeting Luffy from a considerable distance. The attack creates a spiral cutting wave that ignores all obstacles between them.
events.significance: Demonstrates the terrifying power and precision of the world's greatest swordsman. Mihawk's ability to launch devastating attacks from range while maintaining perfect accuracy shows why he holds his legendary title. This also reveals that Luffy's speed alone cannot guarantee escape from top-tier opponents.

events.title: Jinbe Intervenes to Protect Luffy from Mihawk
events.description: Seeing Luffy in danger from Mihawk's relentless attacks, Jinbe rushes in to defend him. The former Warlord attempts to block Mihawk's path and protect Luffy, demonstrating his commitment to helping Luffy rescue Ace. However, even Jinbe's considerable power proves insufficient to stop the world's greatest swordsman for long.
events.significance: This is an anime-original extension not present in the manga, showcasing Jinbe's loyalty to Ace and his willingness to face even Mihawk to help achieve their goal. It also highlights the vast gap in power, as even a Warlord-level fighter cannot effectively counter Mihawk's abilities.

events.title: Crocodile's Sandstorm Brings Buggy to the Scene
events.description: Crocodile unleashes a sandstorm on the battlefield, and the swirling sands coincidentally carry Buggy the Clown directly into Luffy's path, positioning him between Luffy and Mihawk. This chaotic battlefield moment creates an unexpected opportunity for Luffy's next move.
events.significance: Demonstrates the unpredictable chaos of the Marineford battlefield where multiple powerful individuals are fighting simultaneously. Crocodile's attack, meant for other purposes, inadvertently provides Luffy with an escape opportunity.

events.title: Luffy Uses Buggy as a Human Shield Against Mihawk
events.description: In a desperate move to protect himself from Mihawk's deadly sword slashes, Luffy grabs Buggy and holds him up as a shield. Due to Buggy's Bara Bara no Mi abilities, Mihawk's slashes merely separate Buggy's body parts harmlessly rather than cutting through to harm Luffy. Buggy is understandably furious about being used this way.
events.significance: A comedic yet strategic moment showcasing Luffy's quick thinking under pressure. This incident also demonstrates the utility of Buggy's Devil Fruit powers in an unexpected defensive application, and adds to the running gag of Buggy being unwillingly dragged into major events.

events.title: Buggy's Failed Counterattack with Muggy Ball
events.description: Angered by being used as a shield, Buggy reforms his upper body and attempts to retaliate against Mihawk. Using his lower half separately, he launches a Muggy Ball explosive at the world's greatest swordsman. However, Mihawk effortlessly deflects the explosive projectile back at Buggy with his sword, causing it to explode on the embarrassed clown.
events.significance: Demonstrates the vast difference in power between Buggy and Mihawk, showing that even explosive attacks are trivial for the world's greatest swordsman to counter. This moment adds comedic relief while emphasizing Mihawk's overwhelming combat superiority.

events.title: Vista Blocks Mihawk to Protect Luffy
events.description: As Mihawk closes in on Luffy once again, Vista of the Flower Swords, the 5th Division Commander of the Whitebeard Pirates, suddenly appears and blocks Mihawk's path with his dual swords. Vista, known as one of the strongest swordsmen in the Whitebeard crew, engages Mihawk directly, creating an opening for Luffy to continue his advance toward the execution platform.
events.significance: Introduces Vista in a prominent combat role and demonstrates the Whitebeard Pirates' coordination in protecting Luffy's path to Ace. This also sets up a clash between two master swordsmen, though Vista is clearly outmatched by the world's greatest. Marco's tactical decision to send Vista shows the crew's commitment to saving Ace.

events.title: Mihawk's Observation: Luffy's Most Dangerous Power
events.description: While engaging Vista, Mihawk makes a profound observation about Luffy as he watches him continue forward. Mihawk comments that among all people on the sea, Luffy possesses the most formidable ability - not some special power, but the ability to make allies of everyone he meets. Mihawk recognizes this as the most fearsome ability on the high seas.
events.significance: This is one of the most important character observations in the entire series. Coming from someone as perceptive and powerful as Mihawk, this statement highlights that Luffy's true strength isn't his Devil Fruit or combat abilities, but his charisma and ability to inspire loyalty. This observation foreshadows Luffy's eventual rise and explains how he will achieve the impossible. It also shows Mihawk's wisdom in recognizing that influence and alliances are more dangerous than raw power.

quotes.text: It's not some sort of special power, but he has the ability to make allies of everyone he meets. And that is the most fearsome ability on the high seas.
quotes.speaker: Mihawk
quotes.context: Mihawk's observation of Luffy's true power while fighting Vista

events.title: Hancock's Fantasy Daydream About Luffy
events.description: In an anime-original extension, Hancock confronts Smoker on the battlefield. When Smoker inquires about her referring to Luffy as her 'husband,' Hancock goes into an elaborate daydream sequence imagining a romantic honeymoon with Luffy and the joy of cooking for him. The fantasy leaves her in a trance-like state of infatuation while Smoker looks on in confusion. She snaps out of it only when she spots Luffy in danger from Mihawk, which angers her.
events.significance: This anime-original scene emphasizes Hancock's deep infatuation with Luffy and provides comedic relief during the intense battle. It also demonstrates how even in the middle of a war, Hancock's primary focus remains on Luffy's safety and well-being.

events.title: Sengoku Proclaims Imminent Marine Victory
events.description: Fleet Admiral Sengoku addresses the battlefield, proclaiming his absolute conviction that the Marines will achieve victory in this war. His announcement serves to boost Marine morale while putting additional pressure on the Whitebeard Pirates and their allies. Sengoku's confidence stems from the strategic advantages the Marines have carefully orchestrated.
events.significance: Demonstrates Sengoku's role as the strategic mastermind behind the Marine forces and his confidence in their battle plan. This proclamation occurs just before the Pacifista reinforcements arrive, showing that Sengoku's confidence is backed by hidden trump cards that will soon be revealed.

events.title: Sentomaru Arrives with Seven Pacifistas
events.description: Sentomaru, the bodyguard of Dr. Vegapunk, arrives at Marineford commanding a force of seven Pacifista units. His arrival marks the deployment of the Marines' secret weapons - multiple human weapons modeled after Bartholomew Kuma. Sentomaru strikes a battle pose, excited for the incoming fight and confident in the Pacifistas' ability to turn the tide of battle.
events.significance: Introduces Sentomaru to the Marineford battlefield and reveals the Marines' trump card - multiple Pacifista units working together. This is the first time the pirates face multiple Pacifistas simultaneously, as opposed to the single unit the Straw Hats barely survived against at Sabaody. The arrival of these powerful weapons represents a major escalation in the Marines' offensive capabilities.

events.title: Pacifistas Attack Whitebeard's Allied Fleet
events.description: The seven Pacifistas begin their assault, targeting the ships of Whitebeard's allied pirate crews from behind. The human weapons unleash devastating laser beams from their mouths and palms, destroying multiple pirate vessels and causing chaos and confusion among the allied forces. Pirates including Wallem, Brew, Palms, and Brocca react in horror as they witness the destructive power of these mysterious enemies.
events.significance: Represents a major turning point in the battle as the Marines deploy their advanced weapons against the pirates' rear forces. The Pacifistas' simultaneous attack demonstrates the Marines' strategic planning and technological superiority. This assault causes massive casualties among Whitebeard's allies and creates panic as the pirates realize they're being attacked by what appear to be multiple copies of the Warlord Bartholomew Kuma.

events.title: Ace's Execution Time Moved Up - Guards Cross Their Blades
events.description: In a shocking development, the two guards standing on either side of Ace cross their blades in the traditional execution style, signaling that the execution will take place immediately rather than at the scheduled time. This sudden change in timing catches everyone off guard - both the onlookers watching from Sabaody Archipelago and the members of the Whitebeard Pirates are struck with confusion, horror, and anger upon realizing that Ace will be executed ahead of schedule.
events.significance: This represents a critical escalation in the Marines' plan and creates extreme urgency for Luffy and the Whitebeard Pirates. Moving up the execution time is a tactical decision designed to prevent any rescue attempt from succeeding. The shock and desperation this creates among Ace's allies marks a crucial turning point in the war, as time has now effectively run out. This moment heightens the tension dramatically as Luffy is still far from the platform.

themes.theme: The Power of Bonds and Alliance
themes.description: Mihawk's observation that Luffy's ability to make allies is his most dangerous power emphasizes a core theme of One Piece - that bonds between people are more valuable than individual strength. Throughout the episode, we see various characters coming to Luffy's aid.
themes.symbolism: Luffy's advance through the battlefield represents his journey through life - he cannot succeed alone, but with allies supporting him, even the impossible becomes achievable.
culturalReferences: The importance of nakama (comrades) in shonen manga

themes.description: The episode showcases the tension between individual combat prowess (represented by fighters like Mihawk and Luffy) and strategic military planning (represented by Sengoku's coordinated tactics and the Pacifista deployment).
themes.symbolism: The Pacifistas represent the cold, calculated approach to warfare, while the pirates represent the chaotic but passionate individual will.

themes.description: The acceleration of Ace's execution creates overwhelming urgency. Every obstacle Luffy faces becomes more critical as time literally runs out. The episode emphasizes the desperate race against time.
themes.symbolism: The crossing of the executioners' blades represents the closing of a window of opportunity and the finality of death approaching.

themes.description: Mihawk's wisdom comes from his ability to see beyond surface-level power. While others focus on Luffy's strength, lineage, or Devil Fruit, Mihawk recognizes his true threat - the intangible quality that draws people to him.
themes.symbolism: Mihawk's 'hawk eyes' see the truth that others miss, both literally in combat and metaphorically in understanding people.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy demonstrates strategic thinking by choosing evasion over combat when facing Mihawk, showing his growth in understanding when to fight and when to flee. His determination to reach Ace remains unwavering despite overwhelming obstacles.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends Jinbe's intervention against Mihawk into a full engagement. In the manga, Jinbe does not directly fight Mihawk in this scene.

Hancock's elaborate fantasy daydream sequence about her honeymoon with Luffy and her confrontation with Smoker is significantly expanded in the anime with additional comedic beats and visual gags not present in the manga.
The anime adds more extended action sequences showing various pirates reacting to the Pacifista attacks and additional combat choreography that was condensed in the manga.

trivia.fact: This episode features Mihawk's famous observation about Luffy's most dangerous ability - the power to make allies. This quote has become one of the most referenced lines in the entire One Piece series and is frequently cited in discussions about Luffy's character.
Episode 470 covers portions of Chapter 561 from the manga, titled 'Luffy vs. Mihawk.' The anime expanded several scenes, particularly the Jinbe vs Mihawk encounter and Hancock's daydream sequence.

The opening song 'One day' by The ROOTLESS was used from episodes 459-492, covering most of the Marineford Arc. The band reportedly rewrote the lyrics over twenty times to perfect the song, as they had always dreamed of creating a One Piece opening.
Episode 470 aired in Japan on October 10, 2010, and received an IMDb rating of 9.2/10, indicating high viewer satisfaction with this pivotal episode in the Marineford Arc.

This episode marks the first time in the Marineford War that multiple Pacifistas are deployed simultaneously in combat. The seven Pacifista units represent a significant escalation from the single unit that nearly defeated the Straw Hat Pirates at Sabaody Archipelago.

Vista of the Flower Swords gets significant screen time in this episode as he engages Mihawk. Vista is known for his signature dual-sword style and the flower petals that appear when he fights in the anime, which earned him his epithet.
